original_title: Govt. to ink MoU with Yunnan Foreign Affairs Office of China to boost ties
original_body_lines: MoU will be signed during Yunnan Province Governor Wang Yougo’s tour this week
Govt. believes MoU will assist mutual tourism, economic, trade and commerce, education, agriculture, human cultural exchange, health sectors
The Government has decided to sign a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Yunnan Foreign Affairs Office of China this week, to further strengthen economic and cultural ties.

The MoU will be inked between the Foreign Affairs Office of the Yunnan region of the People’s Republic of China and the Department of External Resources in Sri Lanka during the Yunnan Province Governor Wang Yougo’s official visit from 16 to 20 May.
The Government believes the MoU will assist mutual tourism, economy, trade and commerce, education, agriculture, human cultural exchange, living standard of people, and health sectors.
